Back to Basics: C++ Ranges - Mike Shah - CppCon 2025
---

Ranges have been available since C++20 to help enable writing and composing powerful algorithms. The use of ranges (along with the pipe syntax) can help you write more elegant and less error-prone code. But how and where to get started? Have no fear, in this talk I will provide a gentle introduction to getting you started with ranges. After attending this talk, you will be able to navigate ranges, know the difference between a range 'adaptor' and a range 'view', and be able to start using ranges in any C++20 compiler. 

---

Slides: https://github.com/CppCon/CppCon2025/blob/main/Presentations/Back_To_Basics_Ranges.pdf

Mike Shah
